definition: to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]
pole
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. hundred foot pole, progress still further (idiom); fig. much accomplished, still some work to do/to continue to further successes/not to rest on one's laurels
pinyin: bai3 chi3 gan1 tou2 , geng4 jin4 yi1 bu4

sentences.english: Still greater efforts are needed before we can attain our goal .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须百尺竿头，更进一步，才能达到目的。

sentences.english: Further progress in this semester, I want to.
sentences.chinese: 在这个学期里，我要百尺竿头，更进一步。

sentences.english: You have to make further efforts to do a better job.
sentences.chinese: 你必须百尺竿头，更进一步，把工作做得更好。

definition: to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
to forge ahead vigorously/to dedicate oneself to progress
bamboo pole's uppermost tip/(fig.) acme
lit. navigating a boat against the current (idiom)/fig. in a tough environment (one needs to work hard)
lit. one day, a thousand miles (idiom); rapid progress
sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
to stand a good chance/to have great hopes/to be promising
no end to learning (idiom); There's always something new to study./You live and learn.
like rowing a boat upstream, if you stop moving forward you fall back (idiom)
pinyin: ni4 shui3 xing2 zhou1 , bu4 jin4 ze2 tui4

definition: effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
whetstone/(fig.) to hone/to temper/to encourage
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
lit. to ride the wind and crest the waves/to be ambitious and unafraid (idiom)
variant of 再接再厲|再接再厉[zai4 jie1 zai4 li4]
